definition: to move and appeal/to rally to a cause/to impel/to inspire
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)

sentences.english: In the river on appeal, rengar devoted himself to the revolutionary cause.
sentences.chinese: 在江放的感召下，润格积极投身到了革命的事业之中。

sentences.english: He can convey the force of personality, the charm and the charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他能传达出曼德拉的人格魅力和感召力。

sentences.english: The existence of an emotional undertow is an aspect of all politics.
sentences.chinese: 具有情绪感召力是所有政治的一个方面。

sentences.english: Perhaps the enchanted site is the throat, where voice is born.
sentences.chinese: 或许受感召的位置是喉咙，从这里发出声音。

sentences.english: I wish spirit impel the different colors of skin.
sentences.chinese: 我愿精神把不同肤色民族感召。

sentences.english: He has a lot of energy and charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他精力充沛，很有感召力。

sentences.english: So I started asking God for a passion and a calling.
sentences.chinese: 因此我开始祈求上帝给我激情和感召。

sentences.english: It is in that spirit that I welcome each and every one of you to the White House.
sentences.chinese: 正是在这种精神的感召下，我欢迎你们各位来到白宫。

sentences.english: Whilethere are some idols who still keep their vigorous celebrity andinfluential powers.
sentences.chinese: 有的偶像，却“宝刀未老”，感召力依旧。

sentences.english: Everyone who has heard Li's lecture thinks he is charismatic.
sentences.chinese: 听过李先生演讲的人都他很有感召力。

sentences.english: Conceited, capable, charismatic and a mass-murderer.
sentences.chinese: 性格自负，能力过人，极具感召力的一个刽子手。

sentences.english: The letter was the symbol of her calling.
sentences.chinese: 那字母成了她响应感召的象征。

sentences.english: Natural and man-made disasters originate in the collective karma.
sentences.chinese: 天灾人祸是共业所感召。

sentences.english: Everyone who has heard Li's speech thinks he namely attractive.
sentences.chinese: 听过李先生演讲的人都认为他很有感召力。

definition: corrective influence/to reform (a criminal)/redemption (of a sinner)/to influence (a malefactor to a better life)/to guide sb back to the right path by repeated word and example
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
to urge/to prompt/to spur on/to order sb about
to teach by words and example (idiom)
to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
